001package imagingbook.lib.ij.overlay;
002
003import java.awt.BasicStroke;
004import java.awt.Color;
005import java.awt.Font;
006import java.awt.Shape;
007import java.awt.geom.AffineTransform;
008
009import ij.gui.Overlay;
010import ij.gui.ShapeRoi;
011import ij.gui.TextRoi;
012
013/**
014 * This is an adapter for ImageJ's {@link Overlay} class to ease the insertion of
015 * AWT {@link Shape} elements.
016 * Shapes are only geometric descriptions but have no stroke width, color
017 * etc. attached. These are supplied by {@link ShapeOverlayAdapter}'s state
018 * when insertion is done with {@link #addShape(Shape)}
019 * or explicitly specified by calling {@link #addShape(Shape, ColoredStroke)}.
020 * 
021 * When a shape is inserted into the associated overlay it is converted to an ImageJ
022 * {@link ShapeRoi} instance whose stroke/fill properties are set. 
023 * 
024 * See also {@link ColoredStroke}.
025 * 
026 * @author WB
027 * @version 2021/10/26
028 *
029 */
030public class ShapeOverlayAdapter {
031        
032        public static Color DefaultTextColor = Color.black;
033        public static float DefaultStrokeWidth = 0.5f;
034        public static Font DefaultFont = new Font(Font.SANS_SERIF, Font.PLAIN, 10);
035        
036        
037        
038        private static final AffineTransform PixelOffsetTransform = 
039                                                new AffineTransform(1, 0, 0, 1, 0.5, 0.5); // AWT transformation!
040        
041        private final Overlay overlay;
042        private ColoredStroke stroke;
043        private Color textColor = DefaultTextColor;
044        private Font font = DefaultFont;
045        
046        private boolean pixelOffset = true;
047        
048        // ----------------------------------------------------------
049        
050        public ShapeOverlayAdapter(Overlay oly, ColoredStroke stroke) {
051                this.overlay = oly;
052                this.stroke = stroke;
053        }
054        
055        public ShapeOverlayAdapter(Overlay oly) {
056                this(oly, makeDefaultStroke());
057        }
058        
059        public ShapeOverlayAdapter() {
060                this(new Overlay());
061        }
062        
063        // ----------------------------------------------------------
064        
065        public ColoredStroke getStroke() {
066                return stroke;
067        }
068        
069        public void setStroke(ColoredStroke stroke) {
070                this.stroke = stroke;
071        }
072        
073        public void setTextColor(Color color) {
074                this.textColor = color;
075        }
076        
077        public void setFont(Font font) {
078                this.font = font;
079        }
080        
081        public void setPixelOffset(boolean pixelOffset) {
082                this.pixelOffset = pixelOffset;
083        }
084        
085        public Overlay getOverlay() {
086                return this.overlay;
087        }
088        
089        // ----------------------------------------------------------
090        
091        protected ShapeRoi shapeToRoi(Shape s, ColoredStroke stroke) {
092                s = (pixelOffset) ? PixelOffsetTransform.createTransformedShape(s) : s;
093                ShapeRoi roi = new ShapeRoi(s);
094                BasicStroke bs = stroke.getBasicStroke();
095                roi.setStrokeWidth(bs.getLineWidth());
096                roi.setStrokeColor(stroke.getStrokeColor());
097                roi.setFillColor(stroke.getFillColor());
098                roi.setStroke(bs);
099                return roi;
100        }
101        
102        public void addShape(Shape s) {
103                overlay.add(shapeToRoi(s, this.stroke));
104        }
105        
106        public void addShape(Shape s, ColoredStroke stroke) {
107                overlay.add(shapeToRoi(s, stroke));
108        }
109        
110        // TODO: check font/color settings
111        public void addText(double x, double y, String text) {
112                TextRoi troi = new TextRoi(x, y, text, font);
113                troi.setStrokeColor(textColor);
114                overlay.add(troi);
115        }
116
117        // ----------------------------------------------------------
118        
119        private static ColoredStroke makeDefaultStroke() {
120                ColoredStroke stroke = new ColoredStroke();
121                stroke.setLineWidth(DefaultStrokeWidth);
122                stroke.setStrokeColor(DefaultTextColor);
123                return stroke;
124        }
125
126}
